namedStyle.description: Specifies the default font family list ("font-family" property) for the look and feel.
Specifies the default font for the look and feel. This style defines both the default font family (as specified by the DefaultFontFamily named style) and the default font size.
A bold version of the default font.
A very small version of the default font. This style is used for very small text such as inline messages, and copyright and privacy messages.
A small version of the default font. This style is used for text which is slightly smaller than the default, such as breadCrumb links.
A version of the default font which is slightly larger than the default size. This is used for medium sized text, such as level 2 headers.
A large version of the default font. This is used for large text, such as level 1 headers.
A very large version of the default font.
The primary background color in the core color ramp.
The darkest background color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkBackground color.
A slightly lighter background color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkBackground color.
The lightest background color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkBackground color.
The primary background color in the accent color ramp.
The darkest background color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkAccentBackground color.
A slightly lighter background color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkAccentBackground color.
The lightest background color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkAccentBackground color.
The default text background color (white).
The primary foreground color in the core color ramp.
The darkest foreground color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkForeground color.
A slightly lighter foreground color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkForeground color.
The lightest foreground color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkForeground color.
The primary foreground color in the accent color ramp.
The darkest foreground color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkAccentForeground color.
A slightly lighter foreground color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkAccentForeground color.
The lightest foreground color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the DarkAccentForeground color.
The default text foreground color (black).
The foreground color for selected/highlighted text, or text which is drawn on a dark background.
The foreground color for error text (red).
The default foreground color for inactive, unvisited links.
The default foreground color for active links.
The default foreground color for visited links.
The default foreground color for disabled links.
The primary border color in the core color ramp.
The darkest border color in the core color ramp.
A slightly lighter border color in the core color ramp.
The lightest border color in the core color ramp.
The primary border color in the accent color ramp.
The darkest border color in the accent color ramp.
A slightly lighter border color in the accent color ramp.
The lightest border color in the accent color ramp.
Sets the text-align property to "left" for left-to-right reading direction and "right" for right-to-left reading direction.
Sets the text-align property to "right" for left-to-right reading direction and "left" for right-to-left reading direction.
Sets the text-align property to "left" regardless of the reading direction.
Sets the text-align property to "right" regardless of the reading direction.
Sets the text-align property to "center" regardless of the reading direction.

styleClass.description: Style class for instruction-related text.
Style class for emphasized instruction-related text.
Style class for text displayed in input field controls.
Style class for text displayed in disabled input field controls.
Style class for (right aligned) numerical data displayed in input field controls.
Style class for (right aligned) numerical data displayed in disabled input field controls.
Style class for message prompts.
Style class for message data.
Style class for (right-aligned) numerical message data.

icon.description: The error icon is used by the inline message components (eg. messagePrompt, messageTextInput, etc...) to indicate that an error has occurred.
The errorAnchor icon is a version of the error icon that is displayed when the icon is used as a link to additional information about the error.
The info icon is used by the inline message components (eg. messagePrompt, messageTextInput, etc...) to indicate that an informational message is being displayed to the user.
The infoAnchor icon is a version of the info icon that is displayed when the icon is used as a link to additional information.
The required icon is used by the inline message components (eg. messagePrompt, messageTextInput, etc...) to indicate that a value must be specified.
The warning icon is used by the inline message components (eg. messagePrompt, messageTextInput, etc...) to indicate that an warning message is being displayed to the user.
The warningAnchor icon is a version of the warning icon that is displayed when the icon is used as a link to additional information about the warning.

styleClass.description: Specifies the style information for the applicationSwitcher's title text.
Specifies the style information for the body content.
Specifies the style information for the breadCrumbs content.
Specifies the style information for the selected breadCrumbs item.

selector.description: Specifies the style information for breadCrumbs links.

icon.description: The separator icon that is rendered between breadCrumbs links. This is typically a text icon.

styleClass.description: Specifies the style information for the bulletedList content.

selector.description: Specifies the style information for bulletedList links.
The BUTTON selector can be used to apply styles to buttons.

icon.description: The button icon which is used to launch the secondary color picker dialog. Note: This colorField's color swatch is now used to launch the secondary dialog on most browsers. The colorFieldButton icon is only displayed on browsers which do not display the color swatch, such as Netscape 4.x.
The icon that is overlayed on top of the colorField's color swatch to indicate that the color swatch is clickable.

description.html:p: The contentContainer contains two main regions: the body region, which contains the contentContainer's contents, and the header region, which contains the contentCotainer's header text. Styles can be applied to the body region via the OraContentContainerBody style class. Similarly, styles for the header region are specified via the OraContentContainerHeader style class.

These two regions are themselves rendered within an outer container that can be styled as well. There are two different sets of style classes for the outer region, depending on whether a header is present. If a header is present, one of the following style classes is used, depending on the contentContainer's background color:
If no header is present, the outer container instead uses the following style classes:

In order to apply a style to the contentContainer's body or header for a particular background type, a contextual selector can be used. For example, the following selectors can be used to change the properties of dark contentContainer header and body regions:
description.html:pre:
<style selector=".OraContentContainerDark .OraContentContainerHeader"> <!-- Style properties for dark contentContainer header --> </style>
<style selector=".OraContentContainerDark .OraContentContainerBody"> <!-- Style properties for dark contentContainer body --> </style>
description.html:p: And the following selector can be used to change the properties of the dark contentContainer's body for contentContainers which do not have a header:
description.html:pre: <style selector=".OraContentContainerContentDark .OraContentContainerBody"> <!-- Style properties for dark headerless contentContainer body --> </style>
description.html:p: In order to make it easier to apply common style properties across contentContainers of different background types, several named styles are exposed. For example, the ContentContainerDarkBackground named style provides a way to set the background color for all dark contentContainers. This named style is used regardless of whether the outer container uses the OraContentContainerDark or OraContentContainerContentDark style class (ie. whether or not a header is present). See the named style section below for a list all of the available named styles.

styleClass.description: This style class is associated with the body region of the contentContainer.
This style class is associated with the header region of the contentContainer.
This style class is associated with the outer container of dark contentContainers.
This style class is associated with the outer container of medium contentContainers.
This style class is associated with the outer container of light contentContainers.
This style class is associated with the outer container of transparent contentContainers.
This style class is used in place of the OraContentContainerDark style class for contentContainers which do not have a header.
This style class is used in place of the OraContentContainerMedium style class for contentContainers which do not have a header.
This style class is used in place of the OraContentContainerLight style class for contentContainers which do not have a header.
This style class is used in place of the OraContentContainerTransparent style class for contentContainers which do not have a header.

namedStyle.description: This named style can be used to specify common properties that are shared by the OraContentContainerDark, OraContentContainerMedium, OraContentContainerLight and OraContentContainerTransparent style classes.

This named style can be used to specify common properties that are shared by the OraContentContainerContentDark, OraContentContainerContentMedium, OraContentContainerContentLight and OraContentContainerContentTransparent style classes.

description.html:p: This named style class be used to specify common properties that are shared by the four types of the OraContentContainer<Background> body regions. It is included by the following selectors:
This named style class be used to specify common properties that are shared by the four types of the OraContentContainerContent<Background> body regions. It is included by the following selectors:
This named style is used to set the background color for dark contentContainers. It is included by the following selectors:
This named style is used to set the background color for medium contentContainers. It is included by the following selectors:
This named style is used to set the background color for light contentContainers. It is included by the following selectors:
This named style is used to set the background color for transparent contentContainers. It is included by the following selectors:

icon.description: The button icon which is used to launch the secondary date picker dialog.

styleClass.description: Style class for the "about" named child.
Style class for the "copyright" named child.
Style class for the "privacy" named child.

selector.description: Selector for applying styles to links within the "about" named child.
Selector for applying styles to links within the "copyright" named child.
Selector for applying styles to links within the "privacy" named child.

styleClass.description: Style class used for enabled global button text.
Style class used for selected global button text.
Style class used for disabled global button text.
The OraGlobalHeader style class is associated with the globalHeader container itself.
The OraGlobalHeaderEnabled style class is associated with enabled items in the globalHeader.
The OraGlobalHeaderSelected style class is associated with selected items in the globalHeader.
The OraGlobalHeaderSeparator style class is associated with the globalHeader separator items.

selector.description: This selector is used to apply link-specific styles to enabled links in the globalHeader.
This selector is used to apply link-specific styles to the selected link in the globalHeader.

namedStyle.description: The GlobalHeaderItem named style defines style properties that are shared by all globalHeader items. This named styles is included by the OraGlobalHeaderEnabled and OraGlobalHeaderSelected style classes.

The GlobalHeaderLink named style defines style properties that are shared by all links within the globalHeader. This named style is included by the ".OraGlobalHeaderEnabled A" and ".OraGlobalHeaderSelected A" selectors.

icon.description: The globalHeaderSeparator icon is rendered between globalHeader items.

styleClass.description: This style class is used to style the HGrid's expanded and collapsed icons.
This style class is used to style the HGrid's focus icon.
This style class is used to style the HGrid's locator icon.

icon.description: This icon is displayed in expanded hGrid rows.
This icon is displayed in collapsed hGrid rows.
This icon is displayed in the focus column for focusable rows.
This icon is displayed next to the hGrid's locator bread crumbs which display the hGrid's focus path.

styleClass.description: This style class is rendered for each header and can be used to set common properties that are shared across all header levels.
This style class is rendered on the header icon.

selector.description: This selector is used for applying styles to level one headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level two headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level three headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level four headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level five headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level six headers.

namedStyle.description: This named style is included by all of the H*.OraHeader selectors (ie. "H1.OraHeader", "H2.OraHeader", etc...).

icon.description: The icon that is displayed for headers with messageType "error".
The icon that is displayed for headers with messageType "warning".
The icon that is displayed for headers with messageType "info".
The icon that is displayed for headers with messageType "confirmation".
The icon that is displayed for headers with messageType "processing".

component.name: hideShow
component.description: The hideShow component allows the disclosure indicator icon to be customized.

icon.description: The hideShowDisclosed icon is displayed when the hideShow component is rendered in its disclosed state.
The hideShowUndisclosed icon is displayed when the hideShow component is rendered in its undisclosed state.
The button icon which is used to launch the secondary list of values dialog.

styleClass.description: This style class is used to style the messageBox component. The messageBox's background color, padding, borders, etc... can be specified via this style class.
This style class is used to style the separator component.
This style class is used to style the sortableHeader's sort icons.

icon.description: This icon is used to indicate that the sortableHeader is sorted in ascending order.
This icon is used to indicate that the sortableHeader is sorted in descending order.

styleClass.description: This style class is used to style the sideBar component. The sideBar's background color, padding, borders, etc... can be specified via this style class.

description.html:p: The tabBar can be customized via the styles described below.

styleClass.description: The OraTabBar style class is associated with the tabBar container itself.
The OraTabBarEnabled style class is associated with enabled items in the tabBar.
The OraTabBarEnabled style class is associated with the selected item in the tabBar.
The OraTabBarEnabled style class is associated with disabled items in the tabBar.

selector.description: This selector is used to apply link-specific styles to enabled links in the tabBar.
This selector is used to apply link-specific styles to the selected link in the tabBar.

namedStyle.description: The TabBarItem named style defines style properties that are shared by all tabBar items. This named styles is included by the OraTabBarEnabled, OraTabBarSelected and OraTabBarDisabled style classes.
The TabBarLink named style defines style properties that are shared by all links within the tabBar. This named style is included by the ".OraTabBarEnabled A" and ".OraTabBarSelected A" selectors.
Specifies the font family, font size and color for table data text.
Specifies the background color for data cells.
Specifies the background color for banded data cells.
Specifies the border color for data cells.
Specifies the vertical alignment for data cells.
Specifies the border color for header cells.

styleClass.description: This style class is applied to the inner HTML table which contains the table data (column headers, row headers, and data cells).
This style class is applied to the table's top control bar.
This style class is applied to text in the table control bars.
This style class is applied to the table's bottom control bar.
This style class is applied to the table's sub control bar.
Specifies properties for text cells.
Specifies properties for banded text cells.
Specifies properties for numeric cells.
Specifies properties for banded numeric cells.
Specifies properties for icon cells.
Specifies properties for banded icon cells.
Specifies properties for column headers.
Specifies properties for numeric column headers.
Specifies properties for icon column headers.
Specifies properties for row headers.
Specifies properties for detail disclosure cells.
Specifies properties for column footers.
Specifies properties for the totalRow's "Total" label.
Specifies properties for text total row cells.
Specifies properties for numeric total row cells.
Specifies properties for sortable column headers.
Specifies properties for numeric sortable column headers.
Specifies properties for icon sortable column headers.
Specifies properties for sortable header links.
Specifies properties for sortable header links for sortableHeaders which do not support sorting (ie. where sortable="no").
Style class for the active train station.
Style class for visited train stations.
Style class for disabled train stations.
Style class for unvisited train stations.

namedStyle.description: Named style that is included by all of the OraTrain* style classes.

selector.description: Style class for visited train stations links.
Style class for unvisited train stations links.
